item.title: Monopoly GO: Making It Big Rewards And Milestones
item.description:
The two-day Patriotic Parade solo event has ended, so gear up for another fun-filled event - Making It Big, which starts on May 29 and runs for three days . With heaps of cash and lots of other rewards on offer, this solo event offers players an incredible chance to expand their Monopoly GO empire.

The Peg-E Prize Drop event has also started, so players can also get Peg-E tokens through the event's milestone rewards. This guide will give you a detailed overview of all the rewards and milestones in the Monopoly GO Making It Big event.

How To Get Points In Monopoly GO Making It Big

In total, the Making It Big event boasts an amazing 13,200 dice rolls, seven sticker packs, and lots of Peg-E tokens . Earning points in the Making It Big event is simple. Just land on the pickup tiles on your board, and you will rack up points to advance in the event. You can use a high dice multiplier to gain more points.

item.title: XDefiant: Best Loadouts For Echelon Faction
item.description:
There are many different factions to choose from in Xdefiant. Each of them has unique abilities, including a passive and an Ultimate, to be aware of. These faction choices can greatly enhance the potential of Loadouts compared to other factions using the same one.

The two weapons that the Echelon faction doesn't do as well with are the Sniper Rifle and the Marksman . Both of these guns are still fun to play and make great use of the Digital Ghillie Suit, as they can allow one to reposition themselves once their position is compromised, but the faction can help ensure victory better by flanking and providing intel to their allies. Here are the best loadouts to choose when playing the Echelon faction.

4 Best Shotgun Loadout For Echelon

Great For Ambushing Targets

The Shotgun is a brilliant choice for either Echelon ability. With the Digital Ghillie Suit, players will be able to get around enemies more easily to flank them, but the Intel Suit is an even better choice. With the Intel Suit, players can let their team know when an enemy is coming around a corner, allowing them to get the drop on foes with a massive amount of damage, helping to get plenty of weapon XP. Both the AA-12 and Double Barrel are great, but the AA-12 is the better option due to its larger magazine size and faster reloading. Players will want attachments that will raise their Firepower above all else, with a secondary focus on Ammo and Mobility.

Even though the Double Barrel does more damage from the first short, the AA-12 catches up almost instantly with a higher chance of winning a one-on-one if the player needs to reload. Shotguns are great for being up close, but it is also important to have a good sidearm. The D50 should be the players' choice of sidearm while they are armed with a Shotgun and more than 10 meters from their targets. The EMP Grenade can help prevent Phantoms from shielding as players get close to them, but with an ambush playstyle, the best device is the Flashbang . Players can use the Intel Suit to know where enemies are, flashbang them from around a corner, and then charge in while their opponent is helpless.

3 Best Assault Rifle Loadout For Echelon

Great At Various Distances

The Assault Rifle has unmatched versatility, making it perfect for beginners who are still experimenting. The Intel Suit will help players know when they are getting close to a target, letting them either rush in closer, or back up as their prey comes into optimum range without alerting the enemy. The ACR 6.8 is one of the best Assault Rifles in the game, and its base loadout is already balanced. Players will want to make sure they have the best Accuracy they can from attachments to ensure their bullets hit, with a secondary focus on Firepower.

Players who prefer using the AK-47 Assault Rifle might be interested in how the Libertad Faction can use it. While the Magnum is a strong sidearm that can deal with close-range threats, it doesn’t perform as well as the D50. The D50 can also be used from the same effective range as the Assault Rifle, meaning players won’t need to change their playstyle. The best device for this Loadout will be a trusty Frag Grenade to flush enemies out of hiding so that players can mow them down.

2 Best SMG Loadout For Echelon

Great For Aggressive Playstyles

Echelon can really shine with an SMG in their hands. Both Assault Rifles and SMGs are among the best guns in the game, and are great for getting in up close and personal with enemies. They can also be used to concentrate damage from a further distance than a Shotgun. Players' preferred ability will be the Intel Suit. This can let them know the exact moment an enemy is about to come from around a corner, and allow them to open fire just before their target makes the turn. To make the most of this ambush approach, players should optimize their damage output using a Vector .45, with attachments that will raise its Firepower and Ammo stats. This will allow players to outclass any opponent that makes a turn into their fire.

The D50 boasts a good mid-range approach, but those who want to stay invested in an aggressive playstyle might want to turn their focus to the 93R for its burst fire and superiority in close-quarter combat. Since players know where opponents will be, this makes Sticky Bombs great for this Loadout. Players can throw the bomb at the location where their target will end up, and then watch as their targets run directly into where the explosion triggers. Proximity Mines are a close second, but will be more useful for players who leave traps for enemies that might come from behind them as they run for the next objective. Practice Sticky Bomb placement in the Practice Zone to make sure they land at just the right spot.

1 Best LMG Loadout For Echelon

Great For Pouring Out Damage

The LMG might not be for everyone. One of its worst traits is its long reload time, which can kill the enjoyment. However, the gun boasts the most ammo per magazine alongside high damage output. This lets players mow down numerous enemies as they walk toward their objective. The best ability to pair with an LMG is the Digital Ghillie Suit . This is because the duration of its effect is slightly longer than the time it takes to reload the LMG.

Players can freely let loose a barrage of bullets at their enemies, and the moment they run out, spam their ability before spamming their reload button. This lets players reload while practically invisible, ensuring that they're ready to shoot the moment the ability ends. The RPK-74, along with attachments for Firepower and Accuracy, will help to suppress any point and aid allies trying to capture objectives and frontliners on escort duty. In the event of running out of ammo, the D50 will be a good sidearm to fight from an effective range. Meanwhile, the Proximity Mine will allow players to cover any doorway that would leave them exposed to being flanked.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows, Rise of the Ronin May Be a Blessing or a Curse for Ghost of Tsushima 2
item.description:
Highlights

  • Feudal Japan is a hot trend in gaming, with Ghost of Tsushima paving the way for more games in this setting.
  • Ghost of Tsushima 2 is likely on the horizon, following the success of the original game and demand for a sequel, and faces major competition in its historical setting.
  • New games like Assassin's Creed Shadows and Rise of the Ronin are riding the success of Ghost of Tsushima, but might exhaust the topic of Feudal Japan.

There has certainly been no shortage of games lately set in feudal Japan, and it seems that trend isn't close to ending. The recent announcement confirming the same setting for Assassin's Creed Shadows (formerly Assassin's Creed Codename Red ) only further proves the increasing popularity of Japan's feudal era as a backdrop for storytelling. This all most likely started when Sucker Punch released Ghost of Tsushima on the PS4 in 2020, though it isn't the first game to use feudal Japan as its setting. Whether it was the lucky timing of its release, the exceeding quality of its visuals and gameplay, or both, Ghost of Tsushima 's success created waves in the gaming industry that are still being felt today.

When considering the success of Ghost of Tsushima (and even more so now because of its recent PC release), it makes sense to expect a sequel from Sucker Punch. While nothing has been confirmed yet, Ghost of Tsushima 2 's existence has been teased through rumors. Since Sucker Punch would be leaving money on the table and disappointing countless fans without developing a sequel to its critically acclaimed 2020 title, Ghost of Tsushima 2 is likely going to happen. However, if the sequel does happen anytime soon, it may face an uphill battle for recognition in an oversaturated market. On the other hand, the market might actually help it.

Games Like AC Shadows and Rise of the Ronin May Either Help or Hurt Ghost of Tsushima 2

Assassin's Creed Shadows and Rise of the Ronin Are Riding on the Coattails of Ghost of Tsushima's Success

Whether some would like to admit it or not, both Assassin's Creed Shadows and Team Ninja's Rise of the Ronin are at least somewhat riding on the coattails of Ghost of Tsushima 's success. This can be further seen in the number of comparisons that have been drawn between Ghost and its spiritual successors, with Rise of the Ronin labeled a placeholder for Ghost of Tsushima 2 until it arrives. Assassin's Creed Shadows hasn't been compared to Ghost of Tsushima nearly as much, but seeing another game featuring feudal Japan sparks memories of Sucker Punch's instant classic.

It's unclear whether even more games set in feudal Japan will grace the industry anytime soon, and that includes Ghost of Tsushima 2 . However, with the market becoming increasingly bogged down by games that serve as such natural opponents to one another in their settings, gameplay, and visuals, Ghost of Tsushima 2 may find itself greeting a tired audience. On the other hand, all of this attention being drawn to games like Ghost of Tsushima may only help its sequel succeed in the long run.

Ghost of Tsushima 2 May Be Flipping a Coin When It Launches

Currently, there has still been no official confirmation of whether Ghost of Tsushima 2 is in development. In fact, Sucker Punch has played its cards so close to its chest that it has yet to say anything about a sequel, leaving Ghost of Tsushima 2 overdue for an update. As such, should Ghost of Tsushima 2 ever happen, it could be greeting an audience of gamers who have had their fill of feudal Japan games and garner a lackluster reception as a result. That being said, as many other games like Ghost of Tsushima are relentlessly compared to it, there is likely a large remnant out there who would remain faithful to Ghost of Tsushima 2 regardless of the timing of its arrival.

With Assassin's Creed Shadows releasing this November, and Sony all but confirming that Ghost of Tsushima 2 won't be launching until at least next year, the highly anticipated sequel may still want to distance itself enough from AC Shadows and Rise of the Ronin to escape potential consumer exhaustion. That being said, perhaps releasing as close to them as possible would help shine a spotlight on it.

item.title: Grounded: How To Find Ant Queens
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Find The Red Ant Queen
  • How To Find The Black Ant Queen
  • How To Find The Fire Ant Queen
  • Sandwich Recipes & Ant Queen Variants

Obsidian Entertainment's Grounded is a unique open world survival game where players must fight and craft their way through a backyard environment as a shrunken child in a science experiment. Along with the many insects and items players will encounter throughout the game are Ant Queens. These prestigious creatures are difficult to find for a number of reasons.

For a start, they can possess some strong materials used to craft the stronger weapons and armor in the game, but they can also be tamed through the use of recipes in order to pacify all ants of their particular kind and make them harmless to the player. In addition to this, players can also feed poisoned and infected recipes to Queen Ants in order to affect their colonies. Each Ant Queen resides deep within their respective Anthills, but players can usually find them, along with many useful resources, by exploring these areas thoroughly.

How To Find The Red Ant Queen

In order to find the Red Anthill, players should head northwest from the baseball toward the Haze . The Anthill can be found near the border between the Central Grassland and Haze biomes. Having arrived at the entrance, head straight down the tunnel and past the small clearing where eggs are stored. Continue on until reaching a small area with some glowing mushrooms, and then head up the slope to the right.

Keep going through the caverns until finding a room with a shaft of light beaming down in the center. From here, a small entranceway covered with tangled roots to the right will reveal the Red Ant Queen. To access this area, simply head around through the tunnel to the left and follow it round in order to come face-to-face with the Red Ant Queen.

How To Find The Black Ant Queen

The Black Anthill can be found in the southwest corner of the map near the large trash pile to the south of the sandbox. From the trash pile entrance, players have to descend down into the tunnels through the room with the light shaft and into an open section with some glowing fungus . Head down the slope and back down through the tunnel with a red wire running along the ceiling. Follow the wires deeper into the Anthill until you reach the Lab that is located there.

From the lab entrance, turn around and take the adjacent tunnel that is illuminated by yellow fungus and follow it to the opening where a further two lab doors can be seen. Turn right here and head down the tunnel where more debris can be seen. At the end of this tunnel, a small clearing will present itself — along with the Black Ant Queen illuminated by artificial lights.

Alternate Route To The Black Ant Queen

From the sandbox entrance, players can head down the tunnel and take the small slope upward to the left of the first open area. Here, players will find another tunnel heading deeper into the Anthill with the red wires running along the top. Players can then follow this red wire all the way through past the laboratory buildings that will eventually take them to the same lab entrance as before. From here, follow the fungus-illuminated tunnel again and turn right at the opening to find the tunnel leading to the Black Ant Queen.

How To Find The Fire Ant Queen

The Fire Ant Queen is found in the Fire Anthill, which is one of the toughest in the game to enter due to the number of enemies present. There are several possible entrances to the Fire Anthill; however, players should ensure that they are fully equipped to escape as well as enter , since getting out can be just as tricky. The Fire Anthill can be found near the lawn mower in the Upper Grasslands to the north of the pond.

The first possible entrance is located directly beneath the lawnmower . Heading into this tunnel, players should follow it down to an opening that will have lots of marble deposits, then continue following the tunnels further down into the second chamber. From the second opening, continue to follow the tunnels past the light shaft to another opening where various candy items can be found, including an Ice Caps Mint and Hot Chachas Candy.

Heading up the slope will bring players to a room filled with Quartzite deposits, and another tunnel leading out of this area will take players down to a large open pit in the ground. From this height, it should be relatively easy to descend and find the Fire Ant Queen at the bottom near the Yogi Swole Head .

Alternate Route to The Red Ant Queen

Alternatively, for players who have a glider equipped, it will be possible to descend from the top of the open pit, which can be found to the south of the puddled 'wetlands' in the northern sector of the map. The Fire Ant Queen can be found in a small opening at the bottom of the large circular pit standing beneath a toy soldier embedded in the mud.

Sandwich Recipes & Ant Queen Variants

Each Ant Queen will have their own particular recipe (which can be modified for different results). Feeding these crafted items to the Ant Queens will have one of the following effects: either the Ant Queens can be satisfied with good recipes, poisoned with poisonous recipes, or converted into infected variants with infected recipes.

  • The Red Ant Queen requires either a Juicy Mushrooms Sandwich, Poison Mushroom Sandwich, or an Infected Mushroom Sandwich.
  • The Black Ant Queen requires either a Yummy Gum Sandwich, Poison Gum Sandwich, or Infected Gum Sandwich.
  • The Fire Ant Queen requires either a Tasty Toejam Sandwich, Poison Toejam Sandwich, or Infected Toejam Sandwich.

item.title: Fortnite: All Boss Locations in Chapter 5 Season 3
item.description:
Further challenges await Fortnite players who head into Battle Royale for the release of Chapter 5 Season 3, as not only will they have to contend with 99 other players that want the Victory Royale, but they will also have to watch out for, or hunt down, a set of bosses that will offer a fight like no other, for a one-of-a-kind Mythic reward that could change the tides in the winner's favor.

Finding all bosses in Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 isn't going to be easy, as they are reasonably spread out from each other, and with 5 bosses and multiple POIs to cover, some players might miss out on a unique piece of loot that might just win someone the game, whether that be weapon, medallion, or other.

The Machinist

Location: Redline Rig or Patrolling the Map

  • Loot: The Machinist's Combat Assault Rifle, The Machinist's Medallion

Head down South to Redline Rig, where The Machinist might be awaiting a challenger. If she's not here, then she can be found patrolling the map, so just check the map for a golden gear symbol, and track it across the wasteland in search of her. Fighting The Machinist is fairly simple, as she and her armed minions are no match to a player with a decent arsenal, especially when she wields a Combat Assault Rifle at close range.

The Machinist shouldn't be underestimated, as she can be a rather tough fight if players are not prepared for her barrage of decent aimed shots. She's a good boss to hunt, as her medallion and her Mythic weapon both serve usefulness as the storm continues to close in.

Megalo Don

Location: Brutal Beachhead or Patrolling the Map

  • Loot: Megalo Don's Nitro Fists, Megalo Don's Combat Shotgun, Megalo Don's Medallion

Megalo Don doesn't tend to sit idle, and if players cannot find him at Brutal Beachhead, it's more than likely he is patrolling the map in a vehicle alongside a War Bus, so check the map to see if a gold skull icon is on the move. When players find him, it's shoot on sight, as he is immediately hostile and seeking foes. With his patrol, he can be pretty deadly due to their numbers and the turrets of the vehicles.

Since Megalo Don is usually alone with other players nowhere nearby, this fight should be easy enough, so long as players do not try and fist fight him, as that's where Megalo Don specializes. Upon his defeat, he will give players a bounty of reward, with the Megalo Don's Nitro Fist, Megalo Don's Combat Shotgun, Megalo Don's Medallion, and he will leave behind his Behemoth vehicle.

Ringmaster Scarr

Location: Nitrodrome

  • Loot: Ringmaster Scarr's Medallion, Ringmaster's Boom Bolt

Heading to the new POI, the Nitrodrome , players will be in for a chaotic treat. This location will not only have Ringmaster Scarr and her minions, but it will also have an abundance of players, as this open arena is sure to be a popular choice among Fortnite players due to the abundance of loot and car mods made available from the wasteland coliseum.

Players will need to watch out for traps and other players as they summon in Ringmaster Scarr through surviving the Nitrodrome for a short amount of time. Then, when she spawns, they need to find her, as she is usually upstairs. Whilst non-hostile at first, players will want to shoot first and try and stop her explosive potential so they can get their hands on a Medallion, her Mythic weapon, and access to her Lockjaw vehicle.

Cerberus

Location: Grim Gate

  • Loot: Cerberus' Gatekeeper Shotgun

Cerberus can be found at Grim Gate, his famed home during Chapter 5 Season 2. Cerberus may remain, but players no longer need to challenge him by throwing down his idol and summoning him and his pack of hellhounds. Instead, Cerberus wanders around Grim Gate as a non-hostile NPC, and players need to talk to him and challenge him to a duel.

This fight will see Cerberus return to form, where he fights just as he did in Chapter 5 Season 2, albeit, without his wolves at his side. Considering Grim Gate is still a popular choice, and Cerberus is a dangerous foe with a brilliant shotgun, players should watch out when attempting to do battle with this Olympian Boss.

Oscar

Location: Classy Courts

  • Loot: Oscar's Frenzy Auto Shotgun

Players can head to Classy Courts and speak to Oscar , the humanoid tiger in a suit who seeks a challenge. Whilst initially non-hostile, Oscar can be challenged to a duel, where if players win, they will be rewarded with the powerful Oscar's Frenzy Auto Shotgun, a rare weapon indeed, since Frenzy Auto Shotguns have been vaulted, except for this one-of-a-kind that remains.

Oscar was originally found in Chapter 5 Season 1's Lavish Lair, but his reappearance two seasons later has seen him take refuge in a new location. The challenge remains fairly simple, as it's basically a battle of bullets, and players just have to shoot him until he is no more, but always beware of his large shield and health pool, and other players that might leech off of the player and Oscar's weakened states.

f
